desc: This course highlights major visual arts movements within China over the last century, from the end of the imperial era to current times. Students look at a variety of issues: class and gender; China in the world art market, Chinese art past and present, and a variety of "isms" now seen as defining Chinese art. A major theme is to define "visual culture" in all its nuances.
name: Vis Cult/Modern China
notes: Closed to first-year students except with permission of instructor. Contact Professor Kucera at kucera@stolaf.edu
title: Visual Culture of Modern China
